review: I'm not going to repeat what everyone else has already said.  OK, I'll repeat a summary:- FAST FAST FAST.  No lag.  At all.  Apps start up very quickly.  I primarily use Netflix as my video entertainment provider and access it across all platforms (cell phone, XBox, Mac, iPad, et. al).  Netflix is by far the fastest on the FireTV unit.  Because performance is such a big deal for me, it's why I gave it 5 stars.- Remote works great.  I love that it doesn't use IR.  You don't have to have line-of-sight in order to use it.  I've seen negative points about the remote and I disagree with them all except when it comes to gaming.  It definitely stinks as a game controller, but it isn't intended to be one.  So I really like the remote.- Voice search rocks.  This is a two-part bullet point -- Voice recognition (VR) and what it actually searches.  For VR, I normally HATE voice recognition software.  Every other piece of software I've used is mediocre at best and usually just plain bad (XBox Connect, I'm looking at you).  This thing works perfect everytime.  No training.  No need to e-nun-see-ate the words.  Just speak normally and it correctly identifies what you said.  For the results, it is a big disappointment that it doesn't search other applications .  It ONLY gives you amazon content results.  I was actually expecting that, so it doesn't bother me too much, but I know other products search everything so it's an area for improvement.- Easy, straightforward interface.  This is very subjective.  I like it because I'm not a fan of bells and whistles that don't provide functionality.  Give me a simple, intuitive interface any day over a dog-and-pony show.  So unlike a lot of other reviewers, I like the FireTV interface.- Good customer service.  Early on, I noticed my remote needed a software update (you read that right -- the *remote* needed it, not the box).  While attempting to update it, the download seemed to hang.  Long story short -- I got in touch with Customer Service quickly and the rep was as helpful as she could be.  (It turned out to be nothing, really -- just that the software package is large and it has to stream it to the remote itself, which is very slow).There are areas that could be improved, but that's true of anything.  The big thing for me, is it completely met my expectations, which very, very rarely happens.  I'm probably going to get a second one for my TV in the pole barn since the apps on the TV are sooooo sloooow.
